intro: Citharexylum lemsii, commonly known as the New Zealand honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 5 meters in height, characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slight pubescence, contributing to its ornamental value. Citharexylum lemsii is adapted to a variety of soil types and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
